page.title: 14Halls, Lt.Bookham & Fetcham
page.content:
{Lt.Bookham Village Hall}was given to the community by Mrs Chrystie, the temperance reformer, and after a period of dilapidation, is now in the care of a youth drama group (Pose).
{Fetcham Village Hall}was originally a barn, the main structure being about 150 yrs old. In 1933 the 200 residents of the village raised money to buy the building and convert it into a village hall. In the course of the renovation, carried out by voluntary labour, chalk from the newly opened Mickleham bypass (A24) was used in the foundations. The adjoining small hut was built as a British Restaurant during World War 2.
The Hall is the main public meeting place in the village. The hall is run by a council of management & trustees who are elected from the council.
